alert.note: Alert for Clarendon; Lee; Sumter (South Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 28 at 3:44PM EDT by NWS Columbia
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southern Lee, northern Clarendon and central Sumter Counties through 430 PM EDT... At 344 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Sumter County Airport, or 8 miles northeast of Sumter, moving east at 10 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Lee State Park, Woods Bay State Park, Elliott, Mulberry, Turbeville, Mayesville, Lynchburg, Ashwood, Oswego, Manville, East Sumter, St. Charles, Shiloh, Wisacky and Woodrow. This includes the following highways... Interstate 20 in South Carolina between mile markers 118 and 126. Interstate 95 between mile markers 135 and 146. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
